org.strongback.components

Interface SolenoidWithPosition

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Requirable, Solenoid

    @ThreadSafe
public interface SolenoidWithPosition
extends Solenoid
    A special Solenoid that can determine when the solenoid is retracted, extended, or somewhere in between.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  SolenoidWithPosition.Position
      The possible positions for a limited motor.

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface org.strongback.components.Solenoid

        Solenoid.Direction

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static SolenoidWithPosition create(Solenoid solenoid, Supplier<SolenoidWithPosition.Position> positionSupplier)
      Create a solenoid that uses the supplied function to determine the position.
      static SolenoidWithPosition create(Solenoid solenoid, Switch retractSwitch, Switch extendSwitch)
      Create a solenoid that uses the two given switches to determine position.
      SolenoidWithPosition.Position getPosition()
      Get the current position of this solenoid.
      default boolean isExtended()
      Determines if this Solenoid is extended.
      default boolean isRetracted()
      Determines if this Solenoid is retracted.

      • Methods inherited from interface org.strongback.components.Solenoid

        extend, getDirection, isExtending, isRetracting, isStopped, retract

    • Method Detail

      • getPosition

        SolenoidWithPosition.Position getPosition()
        Get the current position of this solenoid.
        Returns:
        the current position; never null

      • isExtended

        default boolean isExtended()
        Determines if this Solenoid is extended.
        Returns:
        true if this solenoid is fully extended, or false otherwise

      • isRetracted

        default boolean isRetracted()
        Determines if this Solenoid is retracted.
        Returns:
        true if this solenoid is fully retracted, or false otherwise

      • create

        static SolenoidWithPosition create(Solenoid solenoid,
                                   Supplier<SolenoidWithPosition.Position> positionSupplier)
        Create a solenoid that uses the supplied function to determine the position.
        Parameters:
        solenoid - the solenoid; may not be null
        positionSupplier - the function that returns the position; may not be null
        Returns:
        the SolenoidWithPosition instance; never null

      • create

        static SolenoidWithPosition create(Solenoid solenoid,
                                   Switch retractSwitch,
                                   Switch extendSwitch)
        Create a solenoid that uses the two given switches to determine position.
        Parameters:
        solenoid - the solenoid; may not be null
        retractSwitch - the switch that determines if the solenoid is retracted; may not be null
        extendSwitch - the switch that determines if the solenoid is extended; may not be null
        Returns:
        the SolenoidWithPosition instance; never null
